intro: Oxytheca dendroidea subsp. dendroidea, commonly known as the tree oxeye, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree with woody stems and broad, lobed leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in spring. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
